title: Firefox 36.0.4 Release

notes.note:
36.0.4: [Security fixes][1] for issues disclosed at HP Zero Day Initiative's Pwn2Own contest

[1]: https://www.mozilla.org/security/known-vulnerabilities/firefox/#firefox36.0.4
Pinned tiles on the new tab page can be synced
Support for the full HTTP/2 protocol. HTTP/2 enables a faster, more scalable, and more responsive web.
Locale added: Uzbek (uz)
No longer accept insecure RC4 ciphers whenever possible

[Phasing out Certificates][1] with 1024-bit RSA Keys


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/security/2015/01/28/phase-2-phasing-out-certificates-with-1024-bit-rsa-keys/
Shut down hangs will now show the crash reporter before exiting the program

[Add-on Compatibility][1]


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/addons/2015/01/13/compatibility-for-firefox-36/

Support for the [ECMAScript 6 Symbol][1] data type added

  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol

[unicode-range CSS descriptor][1] implemented


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/unicode-range
CSSOM-View scroll behavior implemented allowing smooth scrolling of content without custom libraries

[object-fit][1] and [object-position][2] implemented.
Defines how and where the content of a replaced element is displayed [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-fit [2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-position

[isolation CSS][1] property implemented.
Create a new stacking context to isolate groups of boxes to control which blend together [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/isolation

CSS3 [will-change property][1] implemented.
Hints the browser of elements that will be modified. The browser will perform some performance optimization for these [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/will-change

[Improved ES6 generators][1] for better performance


  [1]: https://wingolog.org/archives/2014/11/14/generators-in-firefox-now-twenty-two-times-faster

Changed JavaScript ['const' semantics][1] to conform better to the ES6 specification.
The const declaration is now block-scoped and requires an initializer. It also can not be redeclared anymore. [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/const

[Eval sources][1] now appear in the Debugger
Debug JavaScript code that is evaluated dynamically, either as a string passed to eval() or as a string passed to the Function constructor [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Debugger/How_to/Debug_eval_sources

DOM [Promises inspection][1]


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Web_Console#Type-specific_rich_output

Inspector: More [paste options][1] in markup view


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Page_Inspector/How_to/Examine_and_edit_HTML#Element_popup_menu

36.0.3: [Security fixes][1] for issues disclosed at HP Zero Day Initiative's Pwn2Own contest

[1]: https://www.mozilla.org/security/known-vulnerabilities/firefox/#firefox36.0.3

36.0.1 - Hello may become inactive until restart ([1137469][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1137469

36.0.1 - Print preferences may not be preserved ([1136855][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1136855

36.0.1 - Hello contact tabs may not be visible ([1137141][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1137141

36.0.1 - Disable the usage of the ANY DNS query type ([1093983][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1093983

36.0.1 - Fixed a startup crash with EMET ([1137050][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1137050

36.0.1 - WebGL may use significant memory with Canvas2d ([1137251][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1137251

36.0.1 - Accept hostnames that include an underscore character ("_") ([1136616][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1136616

36.0.1 - Option -remote has been restored ([1080319][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1080319
36.0.1 - Fix a top crash
Various security fixes

[CSS gradients][1] work on premultiplied colors


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/gradient
Fix some unexpected logout from Facebook or Google after restart

Style Editor: Extra white space appearing above the editor for a sourcemapped scss file ([1128747][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1128747

For users who removed the Share & Hello buttons, this new version brings them back unexpectedly ([1136300][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1136300

Firefox Hello does not work for link generators if there is no camera installed ([1106941][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1106941

text: We'd also like to extend a special thank you to all of the new Mozillians who contributed to this release of Firefox!
system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems
 - Windows XP SP2
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8

*Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Firefox, only 32-bit builds of Firefox are supported at this time.*

### Recommended Hardware
-  Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
-  512MB of RAM
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- Mac OS X 10.6
- Mac OS X 10.7
- Mac OS X 10.8
- Mac OS X 10.9
- Mac OS X 10.10

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 2.18 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
